page.title: 10TRAVELLING INTO BELFAST
page.content: My mum took the trolley bus into town when she was about ten years old.There were less cars and lorries in those days and more people had bicycles.The buses were completely red,double deckers and it cost about a penny for the half mile journey into the centre from Templemore Avenue.Buses were warmer,more comfortable with softer seats and they had a driver and a conductor.You didn't have weekly tickets like today but paid the conductor and he clipped you a ticket costing 1d,2d,3d,or four pennies.About 1905-which no one in my family remembers the trams were pulled by horses.Nowadays the transport is different because there is only the driver on the bus and you pay him or use tokens which you can buy in the shop's for 40p each or Â£2.50 for eight.
